info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 1 at 6:15AM EDT by NWS Mount Holly NJ
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Pennsylvania...
East Branch Brandywine Creek Below Downingtown affecting Chester County.
For the Brandywine Creek...including Downingtown, Chadds Ford, Wilmington...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...East Branch Brandywine Creek below Downingtown.
* WHEN...From this morning until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Open adjacent land next to the creek floods. At 8.0 feet, Dowlin Forge Road begins to flood. At 9.0 feet, High water on the Brandywine sends backwater up Beaver Creek. Beaver Creek floods inundating parks and the Downingtown Little League fields.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:45 AM EDT Tuesday the stage was 7.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:45 AM EDT Tuesday was 7.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 8.3 feet late this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late this afternoon. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.3 feet on 06/04/2003. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around...don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi.
The next statement will be issued this evening at 615 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE
